basics.name: Gary Roumanis
basics.label: Software Development Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a perpetual learner and passionate engineer with an eye for detail. I love solving problems regardless of the domain.

work.summary: Currently working on the Dart language team helping to build infrastructure and tools specifically geared towards the web. Previously I was the tech lead for the DoubleClick Search frontend infrastructure.
Helped develop a near real time, streaming, log processing service along with corresponding monitoring tools and dashboards.

Defined and managed the scope of various projects, such as Product Listings and ads in Windowâ€™s Search Charm. Specified requirements, conducted usability studies, triaged issues and assigned them to engineering teams.
Wrote functional specifications for multiple projects including a prototype which allowed for the display of various coupon advertisements within the paid search workflow of Bing.
Designed a framework for harnessing the computing power of humans to solve Multiple Sequence Alignment problems. Available at phylo.cs.mcgill.ca.
highlights: Project received 1st place in the field of Mathematics and Computer Science at the 6th annual McGill University Undergraduate Research Conference.

education.area: Joint honours in Computer Science and Mathematics

awards.title: //oneweek Company Hackathon - Winner
awards.summary: Created an eye controlled wheelchair. The hack consisted of four parts, Tobii eye gaze tracking for Windows, an eye gaze "Joystick" application, Kinect-based "Safe Drive" for obstacle avoidance, and a microcontroller interface to a power wheelchair.

awards.title: Intern App Competition - Runner Up
awards.summary: In two months of spare time I learned the Silverlight framework and C# to implement a fully featured Windows Phone 7 app. The app provided an internet streaming radio service, offering a simple way for people to share and discover music and playlists. The app had over 50,000 downloads and a 4.5 rating.

publications.name: A portable parallel implementation of the lrs vertex enumeration code
Phylo: A Citizen Science Approach for Improving Multiple Sequence Alignment
